C# - Intro

Created:2018-09-22  Last modified:2018-09-22

  • Introduction
  • References

  1. Introduction

    Keywords: C# (C sharp), .NET, .NET Core, .NET Framework, Common Language Runtime

    This notes is on C# language, .NET Core runtime and library

    Things need to know

    1. C# is a programming language designed by Microsoft and led by Anders Hejlsberg. It was released in 2000.
    2. C# is very like to Java in terms of syntax and runtime. Microsoft wanted C# to replace Java.
    3. C# is first compiled to MSIL (Microsoft Intermediate Language), and then use JIT (Common Language Runtime) to translate into machine code (.exe or .dll [dynamic-link library] file) and run.
    4. dotnet.exe is a tool that can run the invoke the main function in .dll file. (We cannot directly run .dll because it is a library, dotnet can help us invoke .dll)
    5. Other languages, such as VB and F#, can also be compiled into MSIL, which means C#, F# and VB can run together.
    6. .NET contains the .NET framework libraries and CLR
    7. C# file has .cs extension.
    8. fields vs. properties: field is a variable memeber, properties (accessor) is a variable with setter/getter method. C# interface can have properties but not fields.

    C# language features

    1. Single inhertance, all inherited from "object".
    2. C# supports reference and value types (Java only support primitive value type). Value types are realized through structs, enum.
    3. C# supports Delegates, which is similar to C++ function pointer. Java can use interface to achieve the same feature but more code
    4. C# supports operator overloading. Only the most commonly overloaded operators in C++ may be overloaded in C#.
    5. C# supports multi-dimensional array, int[,] matrix = new int[3,3];
    6. C# supports static class, Java only supports inner static class.
    7. C# supports getter/setter [Swift]
    8. C# supports string interploation [JavaScript]
    9. C# supports language level asynchrony, but Java does not.
    10. C# supports class finalizer/destructor.
    11. C# supports extension method.
    12. Like C++, and unlike Java, C# use the keyword virtual to allow methods to be overridden by subclasses
    13. A C# namespace provides the same level of naming isolation as a Java package or a C++ namespace.
      However, C#'s namespace is just for naming isolation. Java package also used to organized code. C#'s namespace is closer to C++ namespace.
      imported with the "using" function.
    14. Class name can be different from filename. A .cs file can define multiple namespaces and multiple classes
    15. Main function is capitalized Main, string is lowercase

    Code and run C# .NET program

    To compile C#, you may need .NET Core. To run a C# program, you need .NET Core Runtime (dotnet). (It is like Java Runtime)

    The Runtime is only avaliable for Windows and Linux
